Posts.Content: brant wrote: Hello...I'm new here but have some some major concerns that are keeping me awake at night :) In 12 days I'm going for surgery to remove a lump that is leaking blood out of my one nipple (left), I did have an ultra sound and a mammogram both of which came back negative for anything unusual. Yet my family doctor an the surgeon both feel a lump close to my upper ribcage of my breast area(honestly I'm a DDD and have Very lumpy breast ..I personally don't feel anything out of  the ordinary). i'm scared shi***less at this point because my grandmother had a mastectomy at my age and never emotionally recovered from it.There are actually 3 generations in my family so far with BC..Great-grand-ma ...Grand-ma and Mum. I'm 38 BTW...  I have no idea why the surgeon isn't just doing a needle biopsy instead of cutting me open.....Also I have very severe asthma and don't do well coming out of anesthetic(last time I almost died). And compared to what most people on here are going threw my worries seem very insignificant...so I am sorry for grumbling! I also have no idea how long i'll need off from work after my lumpectomy ..I guess it depends upon how big the lump is ...... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Surgery..but Mamaogram and U/S fine.. brant brant

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2009 10:38AM brant wrote: Thank you Arts ...I actually slept last night so i'm much clearer headed now(it was my first good sleep in 10 days). i'm on my way to my pre-op now so I'm sure they'll awnser more questons for me then. They know about my asthma alread but they knew last surgery I had too and I almost died then ...
